author: BBC News
title: Bus manufacturer Alexander Dennis warns of 160 jobs at risk
text:
Falkirk-based bus manufacturer Alexander Dennis said 160 Scottish jobs are at risk as the result of an "uneven playing field" in the sector.
The firm said it has launched a consultation process due to government zero-emission bus funding "disproportionately benefitting" foreign competitors with lower labour costs.
The company, owned by a Canadian parent firm , employs 1,950 people in the UK, with its biggest plant in Larbert, plus a UK supply chain employing a further 6,350 people.
The firm is calling for higher import duties on electric buses, so that it can compete with the higher pay and better conditions required under government contracts which help bus operators replace their fleets in the UK.
The company's president Paul Davies said: “Competition in itself is healthy, but when taxpayer money is spent with little domestic industrial, economic or employment benefit and bus companies effectively are incentivised to buy from lower-security economies, it creates an incomprehensible dynamic and an uneven playing field."
He added that the firm would "continue to do everything" to save and protect as many jobs as possible.
He said: "We will continue our dialogue with governments to identify potential solutions to level the playing field, strengthen our industry and drive investments in local jobs and domestic supply.”
The union Unite said the announcement was "deeply alarming".
Industrial Officer Pat Egan said: "Be in no doubt that the impact on the workforce and the local community will be huge.
"We are demanding meetings with the company and the Scottish Government to explore all avenues which can protect jobs.
"Because if Scotland wants to promote bus travel and achieve lower carbon emissions then we need a manufacturing base capable of delivering these objectives.”

author: (Foto: Shutterstock.)
title: La ciencia al servicio de tu belleza
text:
El desarrollo científico detrás de las fórmulas para productos del cuidado de la piel es cada vez más notorio y las personas buscan soluciones de alta dermocosmética para cuidarse, verse y sentirse bien. De manera que existe un círculo virtuoso ante las necesidades de los usuarios y la evolución de investigaciones científicas enfocadas en la renovación cutánea.
Para ISDIN innovar y ofrecer soluciones integrales para el cuidado de la piel son su razón de ser, es una compañía global que te invita a escuchar a tu piel y que siempre busca acercar cada uno de sus productos a las personas que lo necesitan y que tienen necesidades particulares.
Publicidad Retinal Intense: un producto para prevenir, reparar y corregir el photoaging
El sérum de noche Retinal Intense tiene como ingrediente principal el retinaldehído, que es agente antiedad muy eficaz, tres veces más potente y 11 veces más rápido que el retinol. Al utilizarlo vas a notar como se disminuyen las arrugas hasta en un 43 % y líneas de expresión de tu rostro. Lo mejor es que vas a rejuvenecer mientras sueñas.
Gracias a años de investigación e innovación es que ISDINCEUTICS cuenta con varios productos que ayudan a prevenir el fotoenvejecimiento, derivado a la exposición a la radiación solar, cambios de temperatura, la contaminación, el estrés y la alimentación, entre otros factores. Algunos de los tratamientos dirigidos que hacen frente a este proceso son la vitamina C, el ácido glicólico, el ácido hialurónico y los retinoides.
La ciencia se convierte en un factor determinante para los productos de cuidado personal porque es gracias a su desarrollo y a un equipo de profesionales que ISDIN trabaja para encontrar las fórmulas adecuadas y probadas para el cuidado de la piel.
La tecnología del sérum Retinal Intense es bifásica, de manera que repara e hidrata tu piel, mientras brinda una sensación de confort. Otros de sus ingredientes son: la melatonina que es de acción antioxidante y el bakuchiol que aporta firmeza y elasticidad.
Publicidad podcast Escucha nuestros podcast aquí Publicidad ¿Sabes que es la retinización?
Ya comentamos que el retinaldehído es el ingrediente estrella de este producto así que, básicamente, la piel debe acostumbrarse al uso de retinoides. Así como en la ciencia, es recomendable que al comenzar a utilizar Retinal Intense lleves a cabo un protocolo de uso, de manera que logres retinizar la piel paulatinamente y toleres la aplicación de retinaldehido diario por las noches.
El proceso es muy sencillo, la primera semana aplícalo durante tres noches, es decir una sí y dos no (por ejemplo, lunes, jueves y domingo). Para la segunda semana la aplicación puede ser una noche sí y una no (continúa el martes, jueves y sábado). Al llegar a la tercera semana vas a percibir que tienes mayor tolerancia al producto y podrás aplicarlo de manera diaria por las noches. Recuerda que a pesar de ser apto para cualquier tipo de piel, incluso para pieles sensibles, lo mejor es que consultes con tu dermatólogo para iniciar con una rutina de cuidado y belleza personalizada.
Permite que el desarrollo de la ciencia aplicado a los productos de cuidado de la piel te acompañe en tu rutina diaria. Decídete a tomar acciones para mejorar el tono de tu piel dando luminosidad a tu rostro; si tienes entre 35 a 54 años Retinal Intense es recomendable para ti.

author: TheLostSwede
title: Cooler Master Sneaker X Bounce PC Revealed | TechPowerUp Forums
text:
The Sneaker X Bounce PC System is a limited-edition masterpiece from Cooler Master. Blending high-tech performance with street culture aesthetics, this system is a collaborative creation with graffiti artist Bounce. Featuring detachable speakers, LED design elements, and top-tier hardware, the Sneaker X Bounce is not just a PC, but a collectible piece of art that resonates with sneaker, music and street culture.
Why Choose the Sneaker X Bounce PC System
The Sneaker X Bounce is more than a PC; it's a symbol of the fusion of technology, art, and culture. For those who value uniqueness, expression, and high performance, this limited-edition system is a rare find.
Stay Informed
For more information on the Sneaker X Bounce and other Cooler Master innovations, follow our social media channels and subscribe to our YouTube channel.
Key Features
Unique Street Culture Design: Artistic collaboration with graffiti artist Bounce, reflecting vibrant street energy. Detachable Speakers with DTS Studio Sound: Offers an immersive surround sound experience. High-Performance Engineering: Built to handle gaming, creative work, and more with ease. Limited Edition Collectible: Only 1000 pieces available worldwide. Innovative Audio Technology: Features LED lights and wireless speaker design inspired by the Bounce Rabbit. Exclusive Artistic Collaboration: Graffiti legend Bounce brings his distinctive style to the PC world.
View at TechPowerUp Main Site | Source

author: Kangkan Kalita
title: Rainfall: Northeast India Monsoon Forecast: Below Normal Rainfall Predicted for Second Half of Monsoon Season | - Times of India
text: Guwahati: As of the end of July, which marks the midpoint of the monsoon season, four out of the seven northeastern states in India have experienced normal rainfall since the season began on June 1. However, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicts below normal rainfall for the northeast region during the latter half of the southwest monsoon season, spanning from August to September. This decrease in rainfall is already evident in the July data.IMD data reveals that Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, and Tripura received normal rainfall from June 1 to July 31, while Nagaland, Manipur, and Mizoram were categorized as deficit. Focusing on July specifically, Meghalaya was the only state to receive normal rainfall, albeit with a 19% deficit, which the IMD still considers within the normal range.The overall rainfall departures for June and July were as follows: Arunachal Pradesh (-19%), Assam (-5%), Meghalaya (1%), Nagaland (-26% ), Manipur (-48%), Mizoram (-32%) and Tripura (-11%).July witnessed a decrease in rainfall intensity, with states previously classified as normal based on the combined June and July rainfall now falling into the deficit category. In July, Meghalaya remained in the normal category but with a 19% deficit, while the other six northeastern states shifted to the deficit category. Manipur experienced the highest departure at 42%, followed by Arunachal Pradesh at 31%. Mizoram, Nagaland, and Tripura each recorded a July departure of 26%, while Assam and Meghalaya saw departures of 21 and 19%, respectively.In a release on Thursday, the IMD stated, “During the second half of the monsoon season, normal to above normal rainfall is most likely over most parts of the country except many parts of northeast and adjoining areas of east India, Ladakh, Saurashtra & Kutch, and some isolated pockets of central and peninsular India where below normal rainfall is likely.” We also published the following articles recentlyIndia to record above-normal rainfall in August and September: IMDIndia was forecasted to experience above-average rainfall in August and September, with favorable La Nina conditions anticipated. IMD chief Mrutyunjay Mohapatra indicated that some regions might see below-normal rainfall. The monsoon is vital for agriculture, with 52% of cultivated area dependent on it. July saw nine percent higher rainfall than average.112190376This July received highest recorded rainfall in 124 yearsIn July, Goa recorded its highest rainfall in 124 years with a mean total of 1,986mm, surpassing previous records. The India Meteorological Department issued nine red alerts due to extreme rainfall. Key regions like Valpoi and Sanguem experienced seasonal totals well beyond 3,000mm. June and July have both exceeded their climatological averages, hinting at an exceptional monsoon season.112176861Punjab, Haryana witness intense rainfallHeavy rainfall brought relief from humid weather in Punjab and Haryana, with temperatures dropping two to four degrees below normal. Significant rainfall was recorded in regions such as Moga, Tarn Taran, Bathinda, and Ambala, causing waterlogging in several districts like Bathinda and Moga. Ambala received the highest rainfall in Haryana at 140.112189258

author: Motley Fool
title: Why Tellurian Stock Popped as Much as 25% This Week
text:
Motley Fool Why Tellurian Stock Popped as Much as 25% This Week Read full article Steve Symington, The Motley Fool December 29, 2023 at 1:46 AM · 2 min read
Shares of Tellurian (NYSEMKT: TELL) climbed as much as 25% this week, then settled to trade up around 5% as of Thursday's close, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence . This occurred as the beleaguered natural gas company outlined significant efforts to stave off its potential bankruptcy.
Tellurian is working to stave off bankruptcy concerns The company has struggled with multiple headwinds in the funding and construction of its massive $25 billion Driftwood Liquid Natural Gas (LNG) plant project. Shares plunged in October after the company formally asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to delay the plant's opening by another two years, to 2029.
Tellurian then raised eyebrows in early November by issuing a "going concern" warning in its third-quarter report. It pointed out that the $59.3 million in cash reserves on its balance sheet at the end of September wouldn't be sufficient to cover its obligations and fund working capital needs for next year.
In a letter to shareholders published Thursday morning, however, Tellurian Chairman Martin Houston noted the company has already made substantial progress since he took the helm three weeks ago. Its moves to improve liquidity and bolster its balance sheet so far include a nearly 50% reduction in general and administrative expenses, a new $37.9 million debt-for-equity swap with its principal lender, and an increased stake (to 7.3% from 5.2%) from institutional investor Chatterjee Fund Management.
What's next for Tellurian investors? Mr. Houston pledged "to be as open and transparent as we can, with the expectation that this will allow you greater trust in assessing our progress."
That's all well and good, of course, and it's great to see the company moving aggressively to improve liquidity. Still, Tellurian's "going concern" warning still highlights that this is a very high-risk stock with a significant risk of bankruptcy .
Story continues There might be significant upside for risk-tolerant investors willing to bet Tellurian can climb out of this hole. But with plenty of other healthier natural gas stocks in this market, I'm personally content watching Tellurian's progress from the sidelines.
Should you invest $1,000 in Tellurian right now?

author: Thibaud Hue
title: \u00ab123456\u00bb reste le mot de passe le plus utilis\u00e9 en France, et c\u2019est mal ! On vous explique pourquoi
text: Le choix d’un mot de passe est fondamental. Pourtant, les internautes choisissent le plus souvent des suites de lettres et des chiffres très communes et facilement identifiables par les hackers. Une étude menée par NordPass et relayée par le site internet BDM, a dévoilé les mots de passe les plus utilisés en France, et le résultat est édifiant.Les mots de passe les plus récurrents sont les mêmes depuis 2022, avec «123456», puis «123456789», et «azerty». D’autres combinaisons pratiques à taper rapidement sur un clavier apparaissent également dans ce classement, comme «qwerty1», «qwerty123», « » ou encore «azertyuiop». Les Français ont d’ailleurs la mauvaise habitude de conserver les mots de passe configurés par défaut, comme «motdepasse» ou «password». Certains surnoms comme «doudou» et «chouchou» font eux aussi partie du top 10. À lire aussi : Piratage de Free : ce que l’on sait sur ces hackers qui mettent la pression sur Xavier Niel Un mot de passe doit comporter au moins 20 caractères pour être sécuriséDans le monde du travail, les internautes gardent les mêmes réflexes. En examinant de nombreux mots de passe volés lors de fuites de données, NordPass remarque que ces combinaisons ressortent encore parmi les plus utilisées. Ces mots de passe sont très faciles à retrouver pour déverrouiller un ordinateur ou un compte en ligne. Par exemple, «123456» est identifiable en moins d’une seconde, tout comme «azerty» et «loulou».Pour «qwerty123», une minute seulement sera nécessaire afin d’être piraté. Il est donc recommandé de créer des mots de passe avec au moins vingt caractères, des mélanges de lettres majuscules et minuscules, des chiffres et des caractères spéciaux. NordPass conseille également de ne jamais réutiliser le même mot de passe et de les réviser régulièrement afin de limiter les risques.
